TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/ Click the “continue” button to start the experiment.
The gloves are sanitized with 70% ethanol and they are allowed to dry for 30 seconds.
Laminar Air Flow chamber is sterilized by spraying 70% ethanol and is wiped using a tissue paper.
The door of the laminar air flow chamber is closed and the UV is switched on for 20 minutes. After the specified time, the UV switched off.
All the materials for this experiment are taken from the lab table.
All the materials required for the experiment are arranged neatly inside the laminar air flow chamber.
All the materials for this experiment are taken from the lab table.
All the materials required for the experiment are arranged neatly inside the laminar air flow chamber.
A fresh 5ml pipette is taken from the beaker.
Pipette is taken from the cover.
Pipette is inserted to the pipette pump.
A bottle containing E3 medium 50X (stock solution) is opened and 5ml of solution is pipetted from the bottle. The bottle is closed.
A bottle labeled as diluted E3 medium is opened and 5 ml of E3medium 50 X is transferred into it.
A bottle containing distilled water is opened and 245ml is transferred into 250ml measuring cylinder.
Bottle is replaced into the LAF and it is closed.

Measuring cylinder containing distilled water is taken and the bottle labeled as diluted E3 medium is opened. Distilled water is transferred into the bottle labeled as diluted E3 medium. The bottle is closed. Measuring cylinder is replaced into the LAF.
A 10 microliter pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
Pipette is adjusted to 2.5 microliters.
A fresh tip is inserted.
A screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride stock solution (1mg/ml) is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride solution is opened and 2.5 microliters of solution is pipetted from the tube. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride solution is replaced into the rack. A screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is opened and 2.5 microliters of solution is transferred into it. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is replaced in the rack.
Pipette is adjusted to 5 microliters.
Screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride solution is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride solution is opened and 5 microliters of solution is pipetted from the tube. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube containing cadmium chloride solution is replaced into the rack. A screw cap tube labeled as 1microgram/ml is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube labeled as 1microgram/ml is opened and 5 microliters of solution is transferred into it. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as 1 microgram/ml is replaced in the rack .
A fresh 5ml pipette is taken from the cover.
Pipette is inserted to the pipette pump.
A bottle containing diluted E3 medium is opened and 5ml of medium is pipetted from the bottle. The bottle is closed.
A screw cap tube labeled as control is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube labeled as control is opened and 5ml of medium is transferred into it. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as control is replaced in the rack.
A bottle containing diluted E3 medium is opened and 5ml of medium is pipetted from the bottle. The bottle is closed.
A Screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is opened and 5ml medium is transferred into it. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as 0.5 microgram/ml is replaced in the rack.
Used pipette is replaced into waste beaker.
A fresh 5ml pipette is taken from the cover.
Pipette is inserted to the pipette pump.
A bottle containing diluted E3 medium is opened and 5ml of medium is pipetted from the bottle. The bottle is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as 1 microgram/ml is taken from the rack.
Screw cap tube labeled as 1 microgram/ml is opened and 5ml of medium is transferred into it. The tube is closed.
Screw cap tube labeled as 1 microgram/ml is replaced in the rack.
The incubator (28.5°) door is opened and the culture plate with zebra fish embryos, (which is incubated for 24hours) is taken from it. The incubator door is closed.
The culture plate with zebrafish embryos is placed under the stereomicroscope.
The objective of stereomicroscope is adjusted and embryos are observed through the stereomicroscope to ensure it is alive.
The culture plate with zebrafish embryos is taken from the stereomicroscope.
And culture plate with zebrafish embryos is placed into the LAF. The culture plate with zebrafish embryos is opened.
A forceps is taken from the LAF.
One embryo is picked using forceps and is transferred into the first well of 9 well plate.
Similarly the embryo is transferred into all the wells of 9 well plate.
9 well plate with Zebrafish embryos.
A 500 microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette rack.
Pipette is adjusted to 200 microliters.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The fluid which is surrounding the embryo in the first well is removed using pipette.
The fluid is discarded into the waste beaker.
Similarly the fluid is removed from the next well using pipette.
The fluid is discarded into the waste beaker.
Similarly the fluid is removed from the third well using pipette.
The fluid is discarded into the waste beaker.
Similarly the fluid is removed from all the wells using pipette.
The fluid is discarded into the waste beaker.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
A fresh tip is inserted in the pipette.
Control tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and 200 microliters of solution is pipetted from the tube.
200 microliters of control solution is transferred into the first well.
Again 200 microliters of control solution is pipetted from the tube.
200 microliters of control solution is transferred into the second well.
Again 200 microliters of control solution is pipetted from the tube.
Control tube is replaced into the rack.
200 microliters of control solution is transferred into the third well.
Similarly the solution from the other two tubes (labeled as 0.5 and 1 microgram/ml) is added to the remaining wells.
A marker pen is taken from the LAF.
Three rows of 9 wells plates are labeled as C, 0.5 microgram/ml and 1 microgram/ml.
A 9 wells plate with treated zebra fish embryos and cadmium chloride is taken from the LAF.

The incubator door is opened and 9 well plate is placed in it for 24 hours incubation at 28.5°C. Then the incubator door is closed. After incubation the door is opened and 9 well plate is taken from the incubator.
The 9 wells plate with treated zebrafish embryos is placed under the stereomicroscope.
The control added well is positioned and the objective lens is adjusted. The normal embryo is observed.
Again 0.5 microgram/ml added well is positioned and the objective lens is adjusted. The partially destroyed embryo is observed.
Again 1microgram/ml added well is positioned and the objective lens is adjusted. The fully destroyed embryo is observed.
